Candidate Name:	Felix Marks
PERSONAL DETAILS
Location: 		London, UK
QUALIFICATIONS
MSc, Concurrent Engineering in Electronic Systems – Bournemouth University (1994)
BA (Hons), Philosophy & Sociology – University of East Anglia (1992)
Professional:
Currently working towards CREST Certified Infrastructure Tester certification.
CAREER SUMMARY
2006 to date: IBM – London, UK
2017 to date
Position: QRadar Cyber Security Specialist
QRadar Advanced Threat Detection. Working in the UK & Ireland with SOC customers including financial services, mining, government, utilities, healthcare and telco, IBM business partners and IBM MSSPs:
Technical sales architect for the QRadar SIEM, Resilient SOAR and X-Force Threat Intelligence Insights toolset to secure on-prem and cloud technologies including Windows, Candidate Name:	Felix Marks
PERSONAL DETAILS
Location: 		London, UK
QUALIFICATIONS
MSc, Concurrent Engineering in Electronic Systems – Bournemouth University (1994)
BA (Hons), Philosophy & Sociology – University of East Anglia (1992)
Professional:
Currently working towards CREST Certified Infrastructure Tester certification.
CAREER SUMMARY
2006 to date: IBM – London, UK
2017 to date
Position: QRadar Cyber Security Specialist
QRadar Advanced Threat Detection. Working in the UK & Ireland with SOC customers including financial services, mining, government, utilities, healthcare and telco, IBM business partners and IBM MSSPs:
Technical sales architect for the QRadar SIEM, Resilient SOAR and X-Force Threat Intelligence Insights toolset to secure on-prem and cloud technologies including Windows, Linux and IP networking, Next Generation Firewalls, EDR, IDPS, Antivirus, Proxies, and Operational Technology (OT).
Creating and delivering the MITRE aligned QRadar ATT&CK Demo using hacking tools such as Metasploit, PowerShell Empire, Mimikatz, dnscat2 and Nishang to demonstrate QRadar's ability to detect advanced cyber threats, including PowerShell exploits and DNS Tunnelling. He won a 2019 IBM Outstanding Technical Achievement Award and a 2020 IBM EMEA Oscar for this ATT&CK Demo.
Promoting cognitive and machine learning capabilities including Network Behaviour Anomaly Detection (NBAD), User Behaviour Analytics (UBA), DNS Analytics and Watson Advisor.
Researching and reporting PowerShell based Windows vulnerabilities.
Teaching Ethical Hacking to IBM’s Security Business Unit.
Supporting the CyberFirst initiative, a UK Government and IBM partnership student scheme, inspired and led by the National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) which aims to support and prepare undergraduates for a career in cyber security.
2006 – 2017
Position: Tivoli Netcool Architect
Working within IBM’s Tivoli Netcool business – a service-level management (SLM) system that delivers real-time, centralized monitoring and alert management for complex networks and IT domains. He was directly involved on the following main projects:
Pre-sales architect and account management for Tivoli Cyber Security, Network Management, and ITSM activities for the UK Telco Sector, including Vodafone Mobile, Vodafone Enterprise, British Telecom, O2 UK, Virgin Media, Everything Everywhere, Easynet and Sky Network Services:
Leading customer engagements with cutting-edge Telco Predictive Network Analytics, Netcool Network Security Compliance and NFV/SDN Management capabilities.
Performing presales of Network and Endpoint Compliance Management, SIEM, Fault Management, ITSM and Network Performance Management solutions.
Delivering complex multi-product presentations, Proof of Technologies, Proof of Concepts, RFIs and RFPs.
Identifying new software sales opportunities.
Owning strategic customer relationships.
Creating customer references.
1995 – 2006 Micromuse – London, UK / Sydney, Australia
Micromuse was an American software company specialising in network management. Notable products included Netcool OMNIbus and Netcool/RAD (Realtime Active Dashboards) which would later become members of the Tivoli Software portfolio. Felix joined the company when they had 35 people and embraced the start up culture. The business grew over 10 years to become a 1000-person company and were then acquired by IBM in 2006.
2003 – 2006
Position: Netcool Pre-sales Lead, Australia & New Zealand – Sydney, Australia
Led Netcool pre-sales activities (Cyber Security, Fault and Performance Management) in Telstra, Vodafone (Australia and New Zealand) and Telecom New Zealand:
Recruited and managed local technical team
New customers included Telstra Mobile, Telstra DSL, Telstra Kaz, Vodafone Australia, and Vodafone NZ. Incremental business was acquired from Telstra BCNM, Telstra SSDM, Telecom New Zealand and Telstra Clear.
Was Micromuse’s regional spokesman, giving press interviews with Technology and Business, Computerworld, Infoworld, CommsWorld.
1998 – 2003
Position: Netcool Pre-sales Lead, UK, Nordics, Middle East & South Africa – London, UK
Architecture and workflow design, requirement analysis, solutions delivery and ma

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
